title: Helpful but Glitchy
review: I decided to give this app a try in an attempt to better manage my anxiety and depression. Logging my thoughts and feelings at the end of each day has made me more mindful of my behaviors. It definitely provides me with a better outlook and perception over the forces in my life that both help and hurt me. However, nearly every time I submit my daily journal, the app glitches and cannot save my story. I have tried multiple times to save on wifi and even data; neither work. It is very frustrating because any documentation will be lost if the app is closed and restarted. Yet the entry cannot be copied either. So the entry cannot be pasted back in if the app is restarted: it must be typed out all over again.

title: Amazing App
review:
** So i am editing this review after their newest update. I do not like that, before the update, you were given a daily question to make you REFLECT on your life. Now that they have updated it, they made that part if the app a premium only section. I think that is ridiculous. 

Its is so great to use. My only problem is that you can‚Äôt see your stats unless you have premium. The reason I have a problem with this is because before you unlock that part of the app, it leads you on that you will be able to see your stats no problem, when in reality you have to pay money for that. But I love how encouraging it is and it really actually helps me think about my day and process my feelings.

title: only nice if you pay up to $100
review:
this app has a very good layout, you can customize the colors and you can choose what to submit each day. it‚Äôs very positive and I genuinely feel good when using the app. I got the app last night and suddenly it‚Äôs saying I need to pay $20 (which is supposed to be a sale price btw?) In order to get the ‚Äúfull experience‚Äù. I said ‚Äúno thanks‚Äù and now it won‚Äôt let me do ANYTHING on the app for supposedly 24 hours or until I pay the premium subscription.
Maybe some people can afford this, but I have a minimum wage job and important things I need to save and spend my money on. This app is so expensive and i‚Äôd end up feeling guilty if I spent that much on it monthly. I don‚Äôt want to feel guilty over an app that‚Äôs supposed to improve your mental health.

title: One Problem
review: I have never written a review for an app before but like whatever I‚Äôm doing it rn. The only reason is that Reflectly just had a pretty big update if I say so myself. And I liked most of it. You get to choose from a lot of emotions and it‚Äôs organized a lot better and more aesthetically pleasing. The only thing I‚Äôm disliking abt now is that it doesn‚Äôt give you your daily questions for free anymore. You have to buy the premium pack and Idk if maybe I‚Äôm just not seeing smthg but tbh it has me slightly upset cause I actually liked answering the questions. Even if it was like the same ones over and over just to see my answers develop you know? But oh well

title: Feeling a little gipped
review: Okay, I‚Äôm not usually one to write reviews but I felt I should say something. To start I would like to say I really did like this app, key word being DID. It‚Äôs amazing, free, cute, and helpful up until about the 7th entry where it says you can not continue unless you pay $15! Now, I‚Äôve seen these things before but none quite as high as $15 which is a 75% discount! (Meaning the original price was $60) and honestly I felt like sad that all my emotional investment had be rudely shut down but yet another app you have to pay for! And it‚Äôs unfortunate because now I‚Äôll just delete it and look for something else. Though if you‚Äôre willing to pay that, then TOTALLY do that. I‚Äôm just saying my experience!

title: Make a computer component!!!
review: Love the app, really do. But typing on my tiny phone screen at the end of each day is not the most effective way for me to get my thoughts out at all. Typing on a computer is much easier for flow of consciousness journaling, which is what I desire. So much so that I downloaded another app on my computer so I could journal in both places. BUT THAT APP IS NOT AS GOOD AS REFLECTLY! And now that I‚Äôve started typing on the computer, I truly cannot look back. So please, just go ahead and make the app compatible with Mac, or allow users to sign in on the website and use the app that way. I just- please, like seriously, do that soon. Thanks! Keep up the good work.

title: I love this app but the makers aren‚Äôt listening.
review: I‚Äôve contacted the makers through messenger and email. Both to no avail. This app was helping me for the longest time and then one day I log out briefly and all my entries had disappeared. Months worth of personal notes and progress I had made. I‚Äôve never been one to journal but i began to love it through this app. Honestly, i‚Äôm hurt and disappointed that all my stuff is just gone. Can it be recovered? I don‚Äôt know. No one has gotten back to me yet. On top of this, the app began to stop working by continuously saying ‚ÄúOur services aren‚Äôt working right now, your entry can not be saved.‚Äù Imagine writing a paragraphs worth of feelings and then having it all deleted before your eyes. So disappointing because I honestly loved this app WHEN it was working :(

title: Deleted my data
review:
I‚Äôve used this app consistently for the past year or so, and I was extremely happy with it. I even bought the subscription service so I could have unlimited writing. 

My favorite part of the app was that i could log in from any device, so my entries could be accessed even if something happened to my phone unexpectedly. This includes entries during the worst periods of my life when my dad has his heart attack. 

Well I logged out, and when I logged in everything was deleted. My profile picture was there, and it said I was still subscribed to the premium service, but everything I trusted this app to keep safe was gone. This app is amazing, well designed, and was faithfully helpful to me for a long time, but I won‚Äôt ever use it again. Until they fix this bug, don‚Äôt use it.

title: This is really a journal to help you out
review: I‚Äôve been struggling with my family a lot lately. I‚Äôve tried to write down in a journal I found a while back and it but this app really questions what I feel and the way I see myself. I can express my relationship problems, family problems and even my deep personal feelings regarding my family turning against me for my dreams and achievements. Some really bad that I‚Äôve been clinically diagnosed with depression. It almost feels like a real friendly therapist I can Be with all the time and it really helps me release the struggles of studies, work and life

title: Almost 5 stars
review: I just wish they didn‚Äôt make it cost money. As I think that would be what sets it apart from other apps. They all cost money but not everyone can buy it. So having an app a hundred percent free could really help people out there. As of right now it‚Äôs pretty good, but definitely could be better. It could suggest things to do when we‚Äôre down, or techniques to help us calm down. Or how to help us be more aware and knowledgeable of our feelings. It‚Äôs not bad though! I like it and it‚Äôs helped. But there‚Äôs always room for growth. Which I hope they eventually make the app better! It has a lot of potential and hasn‚Äôt reached it quite yet.

title: One of the best out there
review:
I have been reviewing how my day was on Reflectly for a little bit now, and it has really helped me!, it can help you too, if you have any stress, anger, anxiety, happiness, excitement , and want to keep track of it ,or if you just want to write about your day and keep the day in a timely order with other days, than this is the app for you!

Even if you don‚Äôt have the money for the monthly payment, you can already have so many features to work with!
I myself Don‚Äôt even need it because the app is already fitting my standards for what it was created for,this review explains plenty of it, but there is so much more! The app developers even put in the effort to give you more than 5 different colors for themes to choose from, absolutely FREE!

In my opinion they did a terrific job on creating this platform to help keep memories in order and keep track of events in your life!
Anyone who puts in the effort to read this, I hope you have a nice day.
Thank you.

title: good but hard to use
review: I am not happy with how hard it is to cancel my subscription. I thought that by deleting my account, it would delete my subscription, and it did not make it obvious that that was not the case. I had to talk to them directly to figure out how, and even when I did I was given the wrong information and could not cancel it how they told me to. I ended up paying for two months where I thought it was canceled. Though I think the app itself is a great tool to help your mental health, I was not happy with how the subscription worked. I personally did not use it enough to pay for the subscription because I don‚Äôt have the discipline to use it every day. If you have that discipline I think it is a great app and way to get to know yourself.

title: very good!!
review: It relieves a lot of my stress and even can sometimes help me sleep. Writing little things about your day or even just a overview of you entire day really does a lot. They will even sometimes ask you these questions that really make you think and it helps me organize my thoughts. Not only that but you can even go back and reread your days, or what you wrote for that day. It‚Äôs nice to go back and look at how you‚Äôve changed over time. So if you are someone who doesn‚Äôt like sharing your thoughts to someone else, and don‚Äôt feel like keeping up with a journal, this app is for you!

title: They took away everything that was for free!!!
review: So not okay! Some of us have been using this app for ages (despite the fact that it was totally glitchy) and now they have properly fixed those bugs and have simultaneously taken away the few features it even had! We no longer than any journal prompts, no longer can title our entries, and no longer are our entries categorized based on date. A total downgrade! This is nothing more than a stylized notepad now. AND! The entire pro account is all for the purpose of them reselling the data they collect on you, TO YOU! They track the data regardless and when you pay for the subscription they literally just give the data back to you in a friendly viewer platform. I've used this every single day for months but frankly this upgrade is a total downgrade.

title: I got scammed by this app
review: I downloaded this app and I started off with the free trial and I really didn‚Äôt enjoy the app I honestly don‚Äôt understand why anyone would pay close to 50 dollars a month for this app so I planned to cancel the free trial and the plan so I wouldn‚Äôt be charged but I had my phone stolen from me so I couldn‚Äôt cancel the plan or delete my account or the app I emailed them and even sent them a copy of the police report so the least they can do is cancel the plan I don‚Äôt have access to my old phone and my Apple ID so I can‚Äôt cancel the subscription I even tried to delete my account but they still charged me and took money from my bank account I don‚Äôt understand why it‚Äôs so hard to contact them when this app is supposed to help you this is a stupid waste of money and I really feel like I got scammed DO NOT WASTE YOUT MONEY ON THIS APP

title: Love it
review: This is a great app! I downloaded it last night and I already love it. I only have two stories down. One thing is that it makes you pick only one reason why your day was the way it was and makes you pick only one emotion that you felt throughout the day. I think that they should allow us to pick more than one emotion and more than one reason why your day was the way it was. But other than that, it‚Äôs a great app and I think people that have depression or other problems could come to Reflectly and write about how their day was if they don‚Äôt want to talk to an adult.

title: Amazing
review: This has helped me so much crap because I suffer from depression anxiety and suicidal thoughts and this app has really helped me get through that and help me I just express how I‚Äôm feeling when nobody‚Äôs there for me because nobody‚Äôs ever there for me I just want to say thank you to who ever made this app because it help me through a lot of crap and I would 100% recommend this app to anybody who has nobody to talk to you were you need to write down their feelings and just needs somewhere to write your feelings in private even if somebody can find it I‚Äôd rather somebody find it then not so I can get help

title: Very good!
review: I‚Äôve never written a review before but I think I pretty much have to for Reflectly. I suffer from pretty awful mental health, and sometimes it‚Äôs really hard to see my problems coherently. I‚Äôve tried writing my thoughts down but it just doesn‚Äôt stick. Reflectly makes it easy, with the ability to put your mood, and activities that make you feel that way (though I wish there was an ‚Äúother‚Äù option, there are a lot of choices so I really can‚Äôt complain.). It makes it easy to look back and see what was wrong so I can resolve it. Overall, very great app, even without Premium.

title: Ok, let‚Äôs talk...
review:
Isn‚Äôt it great to have the start up of your day with a free trial or something you have to buy to use the app? I like the app, but having to buy a free trial to use the app to make you feel good about yourself cost money? I wish that this app did not have to use money or else I would‚Äôve put five stars...
Another thing that makes me a little upset is they send the same email about whenever users complain about the money and the paying system they send the same email to to show that they ‚Äúcare‚Äù!
The app didn‚Äôt really care then they would make specific emails to specific people to make it sound like they care instead of repeating themselves over and over again!

title: Amazing app!!
review: Honestly it‚Äôs m not really the type of person who writes reviews but this app is great!! I really like how it asks you questions but I do have a few concerns. First, they only give you a limited amount of emojis to pick from and it would be kinda cool if we could pick the emoji we want from the keyboard itself. And secondly I am not a big fan about the premium thing because all the ‚Äúcool‚Äù stuff are in the premium but I can handle it!! Apart from these concerns, overall it‚Äôs a great app and I would definitely Recommend it if you‚Äôre the type who loves journaling and would want it on your phone!!!

title: Little problem, but don‚Äôt let it stop you from getting the app.
review: So I got onto the app and clicked the ‚Äúhi reflectly‚Äù button but then I clicked on the enter nickname button and it won‚Äôt let me click on it. I don‚Äôt know this glitch is the app or if it‚Äôs just my iPad. But if it has anything to do with the app, if you could find time it would be amazing if you could fix this. If you‚Äôre wondering why I gave this a 5 star rating is because I didn‚Äôt want to make your rating go down if it was just an iPad glitch. I look forward to coming back to this app once this bug is fixed.

title: Amazing
review:
I really like this. Unlike my paper journal, this app reminds me in the morning in day to write! I take it as a journal, but you can use it for much more. It has categorized quotes, you can post pictures, and a bunch of other features. When I say post pictures; it‚Äôs not a social media app. You can‚Äôt DM or anything. 

Customization

With customization, you can change your color theme. Bunch of colors to choose from within the app. It also has dark mode and light mode, as well as changing ur ‚Äòprofile‚Äô picture. I love it!

Purchases

You can use the app for free without paying. It‚Äôs a very well made app, not nothing cheesy or cheap. It does have a VIP pass you can buy monthly, yearly, or for a lifetime. I haven‚Äôt bought that yet but it does unlock some cool features, but the non-paid version works just fine for me.

Overall, this is a very good app to jot down your thoughts and how your day went. I suggest getting it! There is so much more to the app than what I explained.

title: Very good app, but-
review: I love this app. It's nice to write down your thoughts and how your day went, and I love the little quotes. but my one problem is that it will randomly log me out then when I log back in it deletes all of my stories. When I first got it, I had so many stories that I loved. But then it got an update and logged me out and I lost it all. I was very upset by this. I stopped using the app but recently I started getting back into it, but it logged me out and I couldn't get back in so I had to create an entirely new account. It's very irritating and upsetting when this happens. So if that problem gets fixed, I will have no issues with this app.
developerResponse: {'id': 19243771, 'body': 'We are so sorry you are experiencing issues with logging in, can I ask you to please reach out to our support team on Facebook, or contact us via email at hello@reflectly.app so we can help you with that!', 'modified': '2020-11-20T12:26:13Z'}

title: Good but
review:
I really like this app I thought a free app where I can write and learn but all it is without spending real money is just a dairy and inspiring quotes I get you need money to keep improving but atleast let me see my stats I want to grow has a person and I don‚Äôt have allot of money so I limit the things I pay for when without premium this is just like a journal with inspiring quotes in it it gets me less motivated to try and improve my stats then I start not using it 

I know you need money to update and make the game better but please let there be another way to unlock some premium features like checking in everyday or something like that

title: Likes
review: So I love Reflectly because it s always there to listen and I feel better when I reflect onto this app about how I feel, I don‚Äôt have any real friends who really listens to me except one and I might not see him again but this isn‚Äôt about that my point is that if you don‚Äôt have any friends or family who can listen to you like me, then this app is perfect for you. I have tried so many apps for 3 years and none of those worked because it didn‚Äôt feel like I was telling my story just writing it. But with this it‚Äôs a whole different thing I can actually reflect.

title: Apps is ok, but sure knows how to steal your money!
review: The app is fine, it‚Äôs great if you stay consistent. I tried the free trial and didn‚Äôt use it enough so decided to purchase WHAT I THOUGHT, was a months description, like with post app purchases. It asked the usual question if I wanted to go premium and I clicked yes! NO WHERE does it say it‚Äôs $50 for premium when you agree to purchase it?? ALSO they have well over 10 different ways of purchasing premium. $4.99 being like the lowest for one month, WHY on EARTH would you charge me for one of the largest one at a year subscription NOT EVEN ASKING ME IF THATS WHAT I WANT. title: Great app
review: I just downloaded this app because I am working on my self-care, and this absolutely perfect. Not only is it a great way to write out all your feelings I love the fact that it is digital. And journaling everyday really does make you happier because when you express your feelings you feel refreshed and free. I definitely recommend this app and have already told all my friends about it!

title: really awesome but not a huge fan of the new update
review: i love this app, it‚Äôs really helped me sort out my feelings and thoughts and reflect on my days. i‚Äôve been using the app for about a year and i loved how each day it asked me a random question like who is someone i look up to or if i could have any super power what would it be, but maybe i‚Äôm just confused but after this last update it changed a lot and i‚Äôm not sure how much i like the app as much anymore.i think there‚Äôs now only a random question when you have a premium subscription which is really unfortunate. i also really loved the cover picture of each day because it made each day a beautiful photograph and that‚Äôs all you saw but now it just a timeline that previews a little bit of whatever you wrote which i don‚Äôt like because i love to show and recommend this app to all people but now i‚Äôm worried about opening it in front of others because i don‚Äôt want them to see what i write. anyway though i think this app is really amazing and actually works really well, it‚Äôs very well organized and very easy to use.

title: A Great Outlet! ‚ú®
review: I wouldn‚Äôt get on here and lie to people just so they can download a app. I don‚Äôt really write reviews but feel like this one is really worth it and can help others. title: Too broke to get expansion, BUT LOVE THIS APP
review: I found this app very easy to use, and I love the fact that I can put multiple feelings for each entry, it shows how my emotions aren‚Äôt always just one thing. My skills coach and therapist have also said this app is great for me due to my ptsd and my manic bipolar, because I can use this app to write out what‚Äôs on my mind, track my mood, and even log important things on it so my short term memory issues aren‚Äôt a problem as much. So yes I give it a five star and say thank you for the great app...now I jus wish I could pay for the full years expansion for it.

title: WHY??

Then at night i would fill in my journal and get a daily question. I was going tonight to fill in my journal to find that i had been signed out due to the update. I‚Äôm sorry but, I DON‚ÄôT LIKE THE UPDATE!!! I can not stress it enough. I was always so happy to get my daily question but, i saw that now i have to get premium and pay like 50 bucks a year. I‚Äôm sorry but, i am upset about this update. I hope some sort of person that works for the app fixes this when/if they see it. title: I love it

title: Amazing!
review: I love this game very much. It helps me think about my day a lot more. Everyday I am on my phone, I look and open the app. I select everything, and when it comes to the questions and such, it just makes me think about my day a lot. title: Amazing
review: I‚Äôm actually not a fake person by the way! I just wanted to say this app has truly helped me. I‚Äôm in 8th grade transitioning into high school, and this app has been helping me sort through my thoughts. It has also been helping me keep my anxiety under control. The only thing I would recommend for this app is to after you say how you day is it gives you like an inspirational quote, so if I said I had a horrible day it could say a quote like ‚Äútoday might have been bad but today is not tomorrow‚Äù. title: The Reflecty App
review:
I‚Äôve never written any reviews but this is a really good app. You can change the color to one that suits you, which I wasn‚Äôt expecting.
My first moment.. The additional details that I had put was something like ‚Äúright off the bat the little character made me feel better,‚Äù which has stayed true so far.
The only negative is premium is required for the reflection thing but you still get encouragements daily and you can make a moment whenever you want. I just think more access to things without premium would be a little more helpful.

title: Psychological Backing
review: This app allows the user to document their emotions and daily events. The mindfulness that‚Äôs promoted through daily journaling while focusing on and encouraging users to becoming happier everyday, makes it easier to see patterns in thoughts and behaviors interfering with this goal. This reinforced paradigm shift actually starts to shift the users mindset and allows the self assessment of mood and events to become more positive. It also bridges the time between therapy appointments for patients and creates a log for events or emotional states that can be discussed at a later time. The encouraging daily quotes and relaxing or pleasing images is positive reinforcement of the goal to become happier.

title: I don‚Äôt like the new update
review:
I really like Reflectly before the update it was easy for me to journal without a hassle and the daily questions were awesome to reflect on my life. Now with the new update  its not only hard to work and understand but the features I loved such as the daily question you have to pay for which I can‚Äôt afford to pay the fees to go on premium. I really enjoyed this app but it‚Äôs sad that I can‚Äôt do it anymore please bring the old version back.

I ended up deleting the app and losing many amazing memories and downloaded Daylio, this is an amazing app which is similar to the old version of Reflectly and allows you to edit previous days, it even gives you data on what moods you feel the most you month in colors and much more. If your like me and want a new journaling app choose daylio

title: Simple
review: It‚Äôs nice to be able to track your moods and behavior. Having depression and anxiety I tend to forget more than ever what happens over the last couple of days, can‚Äôt ever really focus or remember so well. I also like that it can be a virtual diary too, it‚Äôs nice to be able to go back and see how well I‚Äôm progressing or not. I‚Äôm not really comfortable talking to someone I know or having to pay someone to listen to me vent or express myself. It‚Äôs sounds kinda sad but the app does send cute notifications that can encourage you in the morning and at night kinda letting you know your not alone.

title: Great UI, Good Formatting
review:
I really like the user interface in this app and the varied prompts each day make for a really pleasant guided journal experience. I‚Äôve always enjoyed keeping a journal but struggle with writing and documenting my day in a meaningful and coherent manner. Having a little hand holding in that matter has been really helpful. 

The only complaint I have is the app has a very annoying bug where occasionally when I try to save the app will freeze and I will loose my journal for that day. This happens twice a week or so. It‚Äôs quite annoying to have to write out passages multiple times. I will keep using the app because the good out ways the bad, and I‚Äôm hoping this bug will be fixed.

title: My therapist recommended this app and now I‚Äôm recommending it to you
review: Being a stressed out human who can‚Äôt remember what I ate for dinner it‚Äôs impossible to expect me to remember how I was feeling last week. With this app I don‚Äôt have to keep a bullet journal In my head in order to keep track of my mental and emotional well-being, leaving space in their for the things that matter. And it‚Äôs so easy to use, in less than a minute I can log how I‚Äôm feeling and move on to other things. If I wanna journal and I don‚Äôt have my book with me this app has setting to help out in any environment and in any situation.

title: Loving it so far
review: I‚Äôve only had this app for a week and have used it every day since I downloaded it. For the first three days I was really bummed but it helped to write about what was going on. When I look back at what I‚Äôve written I realize that the app was actually helping. The only thing I‚Äôm concerned about is the subscription. I haven‚Äôt tried if out and I‚Äôd really like to, but I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôll work. I‚Äôm not sure whether I should or not since I don‚Äôt have a ton of money to spend at the moment. I wanted to see my stats and I‚Äôm a little sad I have to pay for that, but I‚Äôll see if I can convince myself to do if for at least a month.

title: Great App, but One Suggestion
review: I‚Äôve only had this app for two days and am only using the free version but I‚Äôm already enjoying it a lot. I like the reminders to write every day and love the little messages it gives you at the end of the day. It feels like Reflectly is a friend that‚Äôs here for me and supporting me through this bad time that led me to download the app. One thing though, is it not possible to paste things into the app? Sometimes I want to paste a quote or some advice that a friend texted me, but I don‚Äôt seem able to. Is that a premium only feature or a bug? Being able to paste into my entry for the day would really improve the app.

Literally the next day- ok when I tried to open the app it said I needed to sign in, that was ok because I just got it, but I kept on saying something was wrong try again later, I tried later it still doesn‚Äôt work, I had just bought the membership and now I‚Äôm afraid it will go to waste because I can‚Äôt even sign in. title: Best app I have
review: So recently I‚Äôve been having a hard time with life. Had some problems with school and other aspects of my life that caused me to have severe depression. Downloading and using this app was quite possibly the best thing that could‚Äôve happened to me in getting over my depression. Just by journaling, my days had improved my mood and morale just within a week of using it. Just got the premium and now I am able to better track my progress. I‚Äôm telling y‚Äôall, even using the app for free, will help you 100x more than you think it will. Best app hands down.

title: Helps you see yourself differently...
review: Reflectly has guided me in viewing my situations differently- even if there was a more difficult day, I‚Äôve learned to have more GRATITUDE. I go back and read my old entries, and I‚Äôm able to see the best in every situation at every angle. All of the entries serve as reminders and allow me to see my progress in everyday life. I also love the random questions the app asks at the end of every entry and love that I can include daily pictures. The questions have helped me answer questions within myself that I don‚Äôt normally think of so it‚Äôs definitely a brain picker.

title: Doesn‚Äôt let me write
review: I love this app to just express myself without opinions and just get my problems out of my system, however constantly I get the message ‚ÄúSomething went wrong, please make sure you have a valid internet connection‚Äù when I try to start a new story. After hours of waiting and this message finally disappears, I have to wait even longer once I finish the story. Once I title hit and hit finish (or whatever it says) a message pops up saying ‚ÄúAn error occurred, please try again later.‚Äù No matter how many times I force quit, reinstall the app, or restart my phone, the app will not let me start or finish a story. It has a great UI and easy to figure out, but an awful performance and connection.

title: Disappointed
review:
First problem: i decided i wanted to spend 9.99$ a month to unlock my stats, i love this app and it‚Äôs helped my mental health a lot and i wanted to unlock my stats and stuff. it kept taking the money out of my account (happened like 3 or 4 times) but never gave me the benefits of a premium account. 

second problem: you guys should really have a better way of saving stories. i logged out thinking that might‚Äôve been the problem for getting the premium account, and then logged back in thinking it would help and ALL of my stories were deleted. if someone has an account and login you guys should really save those journals. i‚Äôm really disappointed and discouraged now. i think i‚Äôm going to find a different app unless you can get my stories back and get this figured out. i‚Äôm sorry.

title: 5 star rating
review: I rate this a 5 star rating because this app actually makes me feel alive and it lets me let out anything with out it posting or tell everyone about like my friends do but this app lets you review your progress in life and I only had it for one day so far and it absolutely amazing and you don‚Äôt have to pay it just gives you a option to but you just swipe up and it says no thanks but I would recommend this to people who have depressed and anxiety because you can see your progress and this app sends you positive reminders

title: Amazing! But could use a change.
review:
With Reflectly, I have been happier than ever! It gives me something to resort to after a bad day and I could talk about it instead of ranting to somebody else about my problems and annoying them.

     One thing they could change is that they ask you if you want Premium over and over again. It could really change the experience for the better if they stop asking that.

     Overall, it is an amazing app! I wish I could write more about all the good things about it, but I can‚Äôt type 100+ things here. <3

title: premium
review: I love this app. it can help people find ways to unlock their innermost selves. one thing i do not like is that people have to pay a good amount of money to access certain components of this app. i think that it would be beneficial if more things didn‚Äôt require money. i know that a lot of these users aren‚Äôt 18 yet, therefore they might be restricted from their parents to get premium. i think that  they should not have a premium and instead just stick to a lot of adds on tiktok, snapchat, facebook,youtube, instagram because i downloaded it after seeing it on tiktok. so my suggestion is to stay away from paying monthly or yearly and stick to understanding the audience of this app

title: questions
review: i really liked submitting journal entries a long time ago, and i loved getting the different questions everyday. you guys took that part out of answering a a daily question and the last time i was in the app was like 6 months ago eva use of the feast u guys took that part out.  if u added that part back in, I think i would enjoy the app. overall it‚Äôs not my favorite app anymore. it always felt like someone wanted to get to know me when those questions came up each time i submitted a journal entry. i really liked that part and if u wouldn‚Äôt mind putting in the option to turn it on that would be great.

title: Not everyone has a weekend
review:
This app asks you to pour your heart out but then it will tell you in the morning motivation that because it‚Äôs a Saturday you could spend all day in your pajamas! AARGH! If only.. On Wednesday it will tell you it‚Äôs hump day; on Friday it will tell you TGIF! 

Earth to non-essential workers: Not everyone has a weekend! I have worked Saturdays most of my adult career. Not everyone hates their job so much that they have to celebrate hump day! 

The mascots blinking eyes are comforting enough to answer the moment prompts & the support articles are well thought out and well written.

 The notifications are good - they ask you to motivate yourself each morning for a good day. And in the evening they ask you to reflect how your day went. Because both my husband and I are essential workers we often don‚Äôt talk about this each night. One night when reflecting with RefIectly I realized no one else had asked me how the day went. For that I give thanks!

It is a bit pricey. I got a discount for the first year but if it is double to renew it I‚Äôll probably move on to something else.

title: Best Reflecting app!
review:
I downloaded Reflectly about a month ago, and LOVE what it has done for my mental state. I almost fell into a depression when I stumbled upon an advertisement for the app. Curious, I downloaded the app and completed my first check-in. I feel like I now have a great place to privately journal my emotions. The app is amazing and I love it!!
My only suggestion is that maybe we have a bit more options other than journaling with the app? Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I love the journaling, but journaling doesn‚Äôt necessarily work for everyone and maybe there can be a wider variety of options to relax?

title: Truly a great journaling app, just not looking to pay for one.
review:
I absolutely love this app! Ever since the first day I got it it was such a great way to get my thoughts out and have the secure and in one place. It‚Äôs also a lot easier to type in a journal then it is to write..
The only thing I hate about this is now I cannot add anything else to my journal without paying for it and I can‚Äôt really justify paying yearly/monthly for something that I could just buy a physical journal. 
I wasn‚Äôt looking for all the extra perks and helpful tips just a place to keep my thoughts/memories but now I‚Äôm forced to lose all that information and it‚Äôs just sad.

title: The best reflecting app ever.
review: Now that I am in fifth grade, I have a Lotta weird/positive/negative emotions. Sometimes I just need to reflect on my life and myself. Now that I have a phone, once I get home, I‚Äôll reflect about my day in this app. Reflectly allows you to type/speak on the microphone, And not have to write it down in a stuffed book, full of all these weird moments, and overtime that can get really full, and eventually you‚Äôll have to buy a new one, but you won‚Äôt have to even buy it, it‚Äôs free, but fancy props for a journaling book/planner/diary and the book alone is not free so, download Reflectly today!

title: Love it!
review: I really like this app! I never sat down and reflected on each day at night, until now! And I have found that it is very healthy for me! It is helping me break bad habits and form new ones. WAY better than any traditional journal. It gives me accountability and forces me to think about what happened that day, and how I could make myself or situations better. Great app if you are struggling with depression, anxiety, dieting, exercising, motivation, or many other things!! But there is a catch! You must stick it! (To me, it is easy to stick with this app because of the motivational notifications)

title: Nice app but it crashes a lot!
review: I like this app! It‚Äôs simple to use and I like how it makes it easy to write about my day and even add images to remember it by. I also like how it gives you prompts to really reflect on yourself/life. The only issue I have with this app is that it constantly crashes and I have to rewrite my entries multiple times. It also takes a long time to upload images and you cannot upload multiple images at a time. I really hope these issues get fixed with this app because I really like this app. But, I might consider deleting it if this keeps happening because it‚Äôs annoying.

title: Cool!
review:
I really like this app. It's clean graphics and cool macanics make it fun to use. As someone with an anxiety problem, I really enjoy this app. However, my app has been having this issue where the menu bar at the bottom appears and then disappears very quickly. It's very annoying. Also, there is no way for me to return to the main screen after clicking on the statistics page without closing the app completely. This is very frustrating. But other than that, I would recommend this app. üëå

UPDATE: must of been a glitch cause it stopped doing it... very strange

title: Very friendly interface
review:
I really enjoy the set up of this app, how it seems like a neat little digital friendo waiting to hear about your day. I like how smooth the transitions between filling out your journal entry is, and the daily questions to spark expressive thoughts about how you‚Äôre doing or your past. 

My only dislike holding me back from giving five stars is that I really wish there were more ‚Äúhow are you feeling?‚Äù Options. So far none of the options have been a good match to represent the overall mood of my day and journal entries. This element needs significant expansion to be honest. Other than that, I‚Äôm really loving this app.

title: Highly recommended
review:
The app is absolutely wonderful in terms of aesthetics and intelligent content. I love the emotional symbol tags and the mood tracking features. Very well done.
My only no would be on the image entry that cannot be adjusted to the desired date, but rather be posted under the same day. This needs fixing. Another great feature to add is the voice notes where I record my voice speaking rather than writing. I believe our voices reflect our emotional condition in the way speak and the tone we use. Please consider this feature as well.
God bless.

title: It helps a little
review: I have always wanted to keep my own journal, but I knew my parents wouldn‚Äôt let me and they would just find out right away... I found this app, I get to express my feelings more and talk about my day and I can look back to whether today was worse.. or better then yesterday. I‚Äôm not afraid to use this app to write down a short paragraph or sentence of how my day went. I also list down some questions and how I can make my day bette tomorrow! I no longer feel so lonely to know that I have a robotic friend to rely on my outside of school days ‚ô°Ô∏é‚ô°Ô∏é

title: The small things

This app has a feature where I think in the mornings, you get a notification and once you open the app, it gives you a phrase and a daily quote. title: LOVE- plz read
review:
i really love how this app helps you balance you‚Äôre emotions. i recommend this for literally anyone. male, female, young, old. seriously this app can help you relieve stress as well. i find it comforting to write down all your emotions that you may be going through, just to get all that weight off your shoulders. you could be using this app in a really

title: Beauty at its finest

title: Super Helpful
review: I honestly love this app. I don‚Äôt use it everyday, but that‚Äôs one of the things I like about it. It gives you little reminders with cute quotes sometimes during the day. But it doesn‚Äôt send notifications to add a story all the time. It makes me feel so much better about the things that get me down. Just like ranting things and saying (or typing) them helps me. And this app showed me the app Vent too. Which is basically Reflectly with other people to help and for them to help you. But Reflectly is overall a great app and I would 10 out of 10 recommend.

title: Going great!
review: I‚Äôve only just started this app and I‚Äôm already feeling understood! I know that there‚Äôs not really someone there listening to me, but it feels so nice to have a place to write my emotions down without being told my current emotional mindset is ridiculous. I don‚Äôt want to be told that I shouldn‚Äôt feel the way I do, I want to be heard and find a way I can help myself. So journaling really helps me understand myself better, and digitally makes me feel more comfortable. Overall I really recommend this app to keep contact with your mind in your own way :D

title: An enjoyable time!
review:
I have tried many journaling apps and found that Reflecty really has started to resonate with me! If you are looking for a way to make journaling guided and easy to start I recommend this app. 

Having simple questions about how I feel, what I did, and then some notes about it makes the process easy and less daunting. I started writing very little and find my self leaving longer notes, using the activity options as guided points to reflect on!

Give the trial a shot and stick with it for a week. See if it fits you too! :)

title: I love this app

title: Well really I‚Äôm only giving it 5 stars because it‚Äôs an achievement
review: I‚Äôm only giving it 5stars because it‚Äôs an achievement. title: So cool!
review: I wish I could say I have premium but I only have the free version. (Unable to buy premium because Im 14 and don‚Äôt have a credit card haha) But just from the free version- i can already tell it‚Äôs great. It really does make you reflect on your day and appreciate the little things. :) I like journaling but don‚Äôt really like having a journal so this is perfect- it‚Äôs on my phone and only I can access it. I like being able to add pictures from the day and it asking me personalized questions about things- it truly is very cool and definitely worth a five star rating.

title: Awsome Diary!
review: I have not even been on here two days and I love the app! You can tell what you have done ,you can title your ‚Äústories‚Äù etc, you can also say how you feel and their are quotes you can see for free! And the quotes are so motivating and I love how there‚Äôs a little person telling you what to do when you first get the app and your confused, no the little person is not real it‚Äôs just a really cute looking emoji. Going on this app helps me take weight off my shoulders and it helps me with SO many things and I haven‚Äôt even had it for one DAY and I already love it!

title: Makes every day better!
review:
I use this app 5 times a day to check in with myself to be mindful and grateful for everything that is happening in my life. I‚Äôm so happy to have this app!

One small note - developers, can you add the ability to move around the little actives and feelings buttons so that we can organize them as we would like? If I add new ones that I like to use often, they are way over on the right and I have to scroll to them every time.

title: This app is pointless garbage
review:
I saw an ad that said it had AI journaling questions so i assumed it was like a chat bot that asked you questions to help you reflect, which is what the ad suggested. It said it was personalized for your experience.

None of that is true. I couldn‚Äôt even access the app to try it out and accidentally purchased a whole year subscription ‚Äî it wouldn‚Äôt allow me to change the length of subscription‚Äî and it‚Äôs definitely not worth the money. It‚Äôs misleading and is honestly completely pointless.

For check-ins, it just asks you how you‚Äôre feeling and gives you only a few options to choose from. I can‚Äôt easily figure out how to change the options. It also only gives me a few options for saying my emotions about the situation. Nothing is personalized and it feels very cookie-cutter. 

It doesn‚Äôt send anything interesting during the day. When you set reminders, it just sends you boring quotes that are found on magnets or motivational posters. It has a ‚Äúmorning motivation‚Äù but it was seriously just ‚Äúclean your room‚Äù. What? Not helpful. 

Save your money and don‚Äôt waste your time on this. I have no idea how the rating is so high.

title: Nicely done!
review:
I am pleasantly surprised by how motivated I was by this silly lil face on the app! I have like 4 other ‚Äùquick reflection‚Äù tulle journals that I have paid for! None could keep my attention like this one. 
     It‚Äôs very simple, basic colors and setup. (Which I actually like) But I‚Äôm thinking already that they may need more options for the ‚Äúmoods‚Äù & ‚Äúwhy‚Äù section. There are a few that will never apply to me; wish I could put in ones that would help me. 
     Overall it‚Äôs very nice! Seriously considering buying it! What the heck; every woman needs 5 journals, right?!?! üòù lol!

title: Amazing

One thing maybe they could add tho is a positive note everyday after writing a story, to make me feel better when I‚Äôm sad and even better when I‚Äôm happy. another complaint i have is when i delete the app (on accident) it just deletes all my stories! i downloaded them as a file once too but that got deleted and now i just don‚Äôt have access to my past thoughts! really upsetting and don‚Äôt download unless you won‚Äôt ever delete it

title: Amazing app! üíï
review: This such an amazing app because I always try to write in a journal or diary before bed but it has always felt hard for me to do especially doing online school right now I have really long days because of all my school work so I am really tired and just want to go to bed and not write down every detail of my day. review: It‚Äôs honestly so amazing, and it‚Äôs just a time were I can go and review my whole day, and think about what I can do better tomorrow. title: Assumptions :(
review:
Literally the first question is ‚Äúwhat do your friends call you.‚Äù I don‚Äôt have friends so I simply wrote down ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt have friends‚Äù now this things calls me that and reminds me everyday how lonely I am.

Also apparently you can only feel 1 thing each day and deal with 1 thing each day. As someone with borderline personality disorder I‚Äôm happy and out going one second and then a horrible person the next making my day a roller coaster. So where‚Äôs the neutral because it wasn‚Äôt bad or good. Also my problems aren‚Äôt just family today and work tomorrow. It‚Äôs all of it combined everyday....but you can only pick one thing because apparently if you have multiple things then you need to see a therapist ASAP. At least that‚Äôs what I‚Äôm getting from this app.

title: Wow. Just wow.

title: Great app

title: really good but one thing really bothers me
review: I appreciate the mood and activity tracking, journaling and voice memo features. it‚Äôs almost perfect because it has all the features I want in one place. If every time I open the app and the first thing I see is about purchasing premium, it ruins the entire app experience for me. To be honest this one small thing may cause me to stop using it altogether, unfortunately.

title: Good app! But...
review:
I never journal, but this app helped me do it more. Get it. I saw it on an ad on Instagram. Have a good day!

That was my past review. But I‚Äôve reached the ‚Äújournal limit‚Äù so now I would have to pay for premium. If there was a one-time payment I‚Äôd be more willing to consider it. title: love but 1 thing
review: So overall, I really love this app. But, I don‚Äôt like how they made asking you a daily question thing that you have to pay for. The daily questions actually made me feel less lonely and I don‚Äôt even have that. I get that you guys need to make money, but the daily questions The one thing that made me feel like I was actually talking to someone every day with this journal. title: üìÖ Please add calendar view! üôèüèº
review:
I enjoy reading back on my memories and I don‚Äôt like having to scroll infinitely for an older post. I find this app so simple to use which makes it more delightful for me to write journal entries. However, what I would love is for a way to look back on old posts more easily. A simple solution to this would be adding a calendar view of journal entries.  

Initially I felt like I could look past the lack of this calendar feature but the more posts I‚Äôve written, the more I realize how essential this feature is for me. I‚Äôm considering migrating to another app that does have this feature, but honestly if this app could add a calendar view, it would be the best one on the market hands down.

title: Helping hand

title: Great app
review: This app is pretty cool and calming and a nice escape. If that makes any sense. I have been looking for some app to keep my feelings and ideas in, and keep track of all my emotions. title: It‚Äôs ok
review:
I have a few problems with this app
1. It‚Äôs kinda boring to use. I mean, I know it‚Äôs supposed to be a journal app, but maybe you should add some fun stuff.

2. The premium. Most games have an optional payment, but most apps don‚Äôt. This is one of them. I know you ‚ÄúnEeD tO mAkE mOnEy‚Äù but not everyone has the money to afford it. It gives you one free day. ONE. Then the next day, you have to pay the premium. That just makes less people want to use this. Why do you even HAVE a premium in the first place? ITS A JOURNAL APP. The journal apps I‚Äôve had didn‚Äôt have premium.
Over all, this app is okay. I don‚Äôt recommend it to people who aren‚Äôt willing to pay for a premium.

title: Stole my Money, Refused to Work, Broken App
review:
I thought this app would be nice.

It was not nice. Immediately demanded money, deleted all my stories, refuses to let me even sign up for a service I paid for, and when I asked for a refund from both Apple and contacting the customer support directly I got ghosted at first, then was told that ‚Äúthe app being broken does not constitute a refund‚Äù. If a product doesn‚Äôt even work, how is that not? What does this app have to do for me to get my money back, murder my first born? Well, here he is, his name is Tyler.* A waste of time, a waste of money. I hope this app is yanked from the App Store and right into the money-grubbing trash where it belongs.

*this is hyperbole, I have no children, and if I did, I think this app has already taken enough of my life, thanks.üñï

title: It's good, but for the cost?
review:
I love this app. I actually got it on accident due to an error with a free trial, so when I discovered I'd been charged forty bucks I said, "well, I guess I better use it then."

But for forty bucks? I shouldn't have to fight with the keyboard as much as I do. The keyboard sometimes blocks the text. The cursor doesn't show up where it actually is sometimes. It's unacceptable that this app charges what it does with these kinds of errors happening so frequently. 

I hope they fix it, because on principle, I love this app. But I'm not going to pay that sort of money for a broken typing interface when that's literally the point of the app.

title: Please make your app more voiceover accessible.
review: I am low vision. Voiceover is a screen reader that I use on my iOS device daily. For the most part, it will read things in your app OK. But it tends to have problems around text fields. Like where you type in your name. Also, if you use it too much, especially in the tutorial stages of your app. It will make the app crash! Luckily, I have enough vision where I could get past the tutorial without needing to turn on voiceover. But for a totally blind user. It would be impossible! That‚Äôs why I could only give this three stars. I love Apps like this, but they need to be more blind and visually impaired friendly.

title: Not so good anymore

title: It really helps...

title: App is great but how is it supposed to help?
review: The app runs smooth and I get what it is trying to do.  It helps you focus on positive things and gets you to reflect on your day.  This simple habit can really have an impact on your life.  But!  They app also does nagging  things like ‚ÄúDo you talk to you friends and family enough?‚Äù  This is annoying and doesn‚Äôt help.  I don‚Äôt need an app about journaling and mindfulness to suggest that I am not doing enough in life.  How does this help me?  Focus on awareness and what people are doing right app designers!   I don‚Äôt want to open the app and read a comment from my mom.  For this and many of the other naggy questions it gives you, This app isn‚Äôt worth your time and money.

title: Nice but....

title: all in all good app- needs more free exercises
review:
This app was really good for me. I like moments, which is where the AI will ask you questions about your day, but then it will wash why your day was *good, bad, sad, awkward, etc* But that was the only free ‚Äúexercise‚Äù they had too offer

I don‚Äôt really enjoy therapy, but sometimes you need someone or 
something too listen too you, or so you can just right out all of your issues, without having someone criticize you. I‚Äôve only had this app for around 2 days, and I already feel better. When they say ‚Äú38 percent happier‚Äù It‚Äôs true! I honestly feel way happier, and not like a big weight is on my shoulders anymore.

They only negative thing I can really say is: I Don‚Äôt like that you can‚Äôt do any of the other exercises without premium especially since they didn‚Äôt advertise it as an app you need a subscription for.

Thanks for reading
~yours truly: Lily

title: Sickened
review:
People who subscribe are "38% happier"? Based on what? How did they come up with that number, and where is the study group that they tested? If they're saying this from all users, that means the information you're inputting is NOT confidential. Think about that. Or it's a scam, idk which is worse.

Also, for the stories, they seem extremely childish and dumbed down for the free version. For the first one, it asked me three multiple choice questions that were very vague, then had me title my "story"? I don't know what that's supposed to achieve, but when I'm looking for a journal app, I expect there to be a place to, um, journal? There was NO WHERE to do that. I wouldn't waste the time unless you like being scammed 50 dollars for a year of worthless multiple choice questions.

title: Is this just about money?
review: Hello. I used Reflectly in the beginning and middle of 2020, it really helped improve my mental health and I was recommending this app to friends. I experienced a loss and stopped using reflectly, but my New Years resolution included getting back to using Reflectly daily to try preventing another depressive episode. But no... it seems like I need a subscription now. Not everyone has the money to pay monthly, but everyone deserves the option to have an organized journal of thoughts and feelings. I noticed some other newer features, but the most basic of all should be accessible to all users. Until everyone can write out their feelings daily without worrying about a subscription, I have to rate this with one star.

title: Ups and Downs

title: Amazing!

title: Amazing !

title: This app is helps a ton

title: Amazing app

title: A little exhausting to use if you don‚Äôt have the dough.
review:
As a free app there‚Äôs a lot to be desired. And the app likes to remind you of that, constantly shoving stuff to do with how you could get such a better experience if you just subscribed. Like I get it, if I had any income I‚Äôd consider it, but this constant poking makes me more likely to give up on anything to do with getting better or tracking my mood than to pay for a single daily reflection.

Can‚Äôt even look at any data from from what I‚Äôve been putting in. Giving up on this app. If you have money I‚Äôm sure you may have a better experience, but this honestly has made me feel worse using it.

title: Love it but...
review: Well I do enjoy the app! It‚Äôs amaing, I just downloaded it today! I stated writing how I felt right away! I‚Äôm disappointed because people don‚Äôt wanna pay for extra support and stuff. You shouldn‚Äôt make us pay to continue! This should be fixed! Otherwise this app is amazing 5/5! I do highly recommend this app!

title: Why the Premium?
review:
I like the app. It allows me to document my feelings and things currently happing to me. It‚Äôs almost like I can vent to myself. My problem starts here though. Why are you putting a price on those who want to get better with mental illness? The ‚Äúpremium‚Äù options have so much that could help those who need it. But do you really think they‚Äôre going to pay for something like that? 
I came to this app seeking a way to help myself with my own mental problems and my feelings. Unfortunately, all I can do is document what I‚Äôm experiencing. I can‚Äôt buy the premium. But, I mean, I guess it still helps to write everything I‚Äôm feeling down. But I could‚Äôve just used google docs for that, not some app from the App Store. 

If you really needed money, just put some adds in and offer a way to remove them, not add a premium version with tons of other features that could help those who need it. 

Then again, maybe I sound stupid to everyone else. I don‚Äôt know.

title: Don‚Äôt get this app! Inappropriate questions and I was scammed!

In the past I‚Äôve been low key suicidal, I put in the app that I had a bad day and it asked ‚Äúif you were to be gone tomorrow, what‚Äôs left unsaid‚Äù! That‚Äôs completely inappropriate, I was just sat there thinking ‚Äúwhat if I died?‚Äù ‚ÄúShould I die?‚Äù. This could have easily been avoided if this question had just not been in the system. I don‚Äôt know who made this app and I don‚Äôt care, they should learn a thing or two about mental illness. I also want a refund.

title: Great app

title: Overall great, but with major bugs
review: Great app, but there are a handful of very very annoying bugs. The worst one is that sometimes after writing my entry, I tap the button to submit and it just loads forever (even if I have perfect WiFi or cell signal). Then, I think that I‚Äôll just select all and copy what I wrote, start over with a new entry, and paste what I wrote in. But I can‚Äôt! The ‚Äúselect all‚Äù feature of the little copy/paste menu is inexplicably missing when I try to select what I‚Äôve written. So I have to screen grab my entry, start over, and then rewrite the whole entry while referencing the screen grab. That‚Äôs now happened almost 10 separate times and I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs right given I‚Äôm paying for this app.

review:
I have downloaded this app before during a hard time- hoping that this app would really help like the other reviews say (mind that I had first downloaded this a while ago). I ran through the process of customizing- putting in a nickname, choosing a color, how I‚Äôm feeling and what the issue was and so on- but when it came to making the account, it had always said ‚ÄúSomething Went Wrong- Please Try Again‚Äù

Same thing...

Same thing...

Same. Thing.

title: Amazing

title: Used to be a helpful app...
review:
I‚Äôll preface this by saying I‚Äôve had Reflectly for a couple years now, and though I haven‚Äôt used it as much as I probably could have, I‚Äôve enjoyed the times that I have. Every time I come back, I feel like there‚Äôs another amazing feature. However, it seems that each one also comes with a setback.

At first, it was simple: just journal as you please. Then, they introduced photos. (One suggestion: just as you can set a journal entry for any day in the past, this should be available for photos, too.)

Just recently, I checked onto the app again to make an entry only to realize that I can‚Äôt. That‚Äôs right. No more Reflectly Premium - just Reflectly or no Reflectly. That‚Äôs it. Reflectly has reserved almost every single feature of their app for Premium users only.

I rate this app 2 stars because although it has some awesome things about it, the fact that they‚Äôve focused their intents so much on money leads me to the conclusion that they‚Äôre no longer concerned with the actual mental health of their users, exactly what they claim to care about most.

title: Refused to let me journal

Eventually they even prevented me from seeing my old entries to even attempt to recover my precious memories that had been stored here. It‚Äôs not worth it, use another app such as OneJournal.

title: Amazing

title: This app made a bad week even worse
review: This week, has been really tough for me, I lost my grandmother, and one of my best friends is battling depression, I could go on, but anyway, I purchased it to journal my thoughts and to vent, but on my sixth day of attempting to access the app, I was met with a screen that I had seen when I first opened it, ‚ÄúHi, I‚Äôm Reflectly...‚Äù so I filled out all of the info, but then it wanted me to pay for a monthly, yearly, or lifetime subscription. In a desperate attempt to reclaim my stories, I purchased a monthly subscription, only to discover that I could reclaim none of them. I am deeply upset because during this chaotic week- I wrote my heart and soul into this app, only to find that all of it had been discovered.

title: Super glitchy, unfortunately
review:
I'm in love with the concept and design of this app - I just wish there weren't so many errors consistently.. 

I bought a month subscription to try it out, and immediately couldn't seem to make a new account. I had to reboot the app 3 times before it took. 

Then once I was in, I tried to write my first entry and it wouldn't let me. 

Finally, I did - and I went back to edit the notes I wanted to include; but once I tried to hit save, the app again said there was an error and I lost my notes. :/ 

I'm disappointed to say the least. This is why I think these types of apps should have a trial period. I feel taken advantage of; after I pay my subscription (in order to initially experience the app, you must)it barely functions correctly. 

I hope it gets corrected soon; the idea of Reflectly is really neat and I'd love to immerse myself in it once it's functioning. 

In the meantime, I'm going to inspect competitors.

title: Not A Writer

Not only that, but I‚Äôm meet with a sense of ease when I open the app. I can talk about my day without having someone critique me. I can talk about my feelings, and I feel comfortable doing it. Using the app I write constantly now.  It‚Äôs a lot cheaper than therapy.

title: A more modern, accessible way to journal
review: I downloaded the app after seeing an ad posted online. It looked cute‚Äî so I gave it a try. Reflectly has turned out to be a great solution to my fondness of journaling and laziness to actually sit down and write. It‚Äôs easy to write about my day right before I fall asleep and catalog the memories of the day. I highly recommend this for anyone looking to start journaling as a way to keep track of their thoughts and anxieties. Or anyone who just loves journaling!

title: This is awesome!! It cured my depression!

title: Get a Notebook
review: There‚Äôs never enough free content on these apps. Duolingo runs completely free with far more features than this app. The quotes you get unlocked are short ones, ridiculous ones that have absolutely no deeper meaning other than someone from the Smith family said it, and ones about sadness. All the other ones I assume are more worthwhile are blocked behind a subscription of $47 a year which I still think is too much to commit to after only a 7 day free trial. If you want to journal every day, getting a notebook would be a better alternative than paying $47 annually for an app I‚Äôm sure to forget in two weeks.

title: Thank you Reflectly
review: I‚Äôm honestly so glad I looked for an app like this when I did because idk what I would be doing rn or where I would be. Bottling things up is never good. This app allows you to reflect, vent, and let go of whatever is on your mind & it even asks you a random question at the end which is helpful because after venting you can get your mind off of whatever happened in your day and focus on something different for a while.

title: My Rating! Overall amazing!
review:
Hey what‚Äôs up I‚Äôm Sophie! I was diagnosed with anxiety and depression 3 years ago (when I was 10). My mother took me to multiple therapists until we found the perfect one, and I call her Miss Macy. Immediately, she referred me to this app for when I couldn‚Äôt go to her appointments. I have been using this app since I was 11. It‚Äôs been a great experience! I would recommend a few things about premium. I don‚Äôt like that premium is locking off the actually important stuff. I understand that the benefit for the developers of the app is to earn money and profit, BUT, here‚Äôs a way to change premium. Just add extra cool features (like stickers, decorations on your profile, or something cool like that) for premium! Then you can unlock everything else. üíñü¶ãüåπüíïüè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà

Sorry for the longggg paragraph haha

~Truly yours,
Sophie xxx

title: Reflectly

title: Amazing
review:

title: Needs some improvements

title: This app is amazing! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Reflectly

title: Reflectly Pros and Cons
review: Reflectly is a great way to express feeling that you are keeping on the inside it‚Äôs like a secret person you can tell everything and anything to. It can never judge you and really lets you reflect on your day and what you can do better next time. userName: k i t t e n. C a t. K i t t y
title: It‚Äôs great
review: It really makes you feel like someone is there for you when theirs not, the quotes make you really feel special once you read them too. If you have stuff you don‚Äôt want to tell anyone else this is a great app to get everything off your chest without saying it to a person you‚Äôre close to. I have stuff that I keep to myself that I don‚Äôt want to tell anybody and it feels great to get it off my chest with this app.

title: Could be better
review: I‚Äôm a very reflective person and was hoping that this could help me work through some harder things I was going through in terms of processing and reflection. I use the daily calm app for meditation and they have recently added in a daily reflection question. These questions have been thoughtful and are asked in a mindful manner/intentional approach. I find the approach to Reflectly and the way questions are oriented to be kind of childlike and at times very pointed/judgmental. This may be a style that works for some but it is not one I have responded well to. The concept, in theory, is great, but the implementation needs work.

title: App crashes mid ‚Äúcheck-in‚Äù
review:
I love this app. It‚Äôs really great. The daily motivations are something I always look forward to! I enjoy journaling how I feel and even just uploading a photo of something that makes me happy or has upset me. But one thing I can say is, I‚Äôm glad I don‚Äôt pay for the app. It constantly causes my phone to overheat while I‚Äôm journaling, and it freezes as I‚Äôm typing, then crashes and I have to retype everything again. It‚Äôs kind of irritating and honestly it happens for me way to often. 
Hope there‚Äôs a fix for it soon tho!

title: The update changed it all

I got on to write and I see that it‚Äôs very different. It doesn‚Äôt ask me questions anymore just how I‚Äôm feeling, what made me feel that, and moods. I also see that my old memories are gone which I‚Äôm really sad about. Other than that it‚Äôs a pretty good app but I liked the old one better.

For example as I‚Äôm typing this the iPad is autocapitalizing the beginning of my sentence. Then when I get to the end I double tap ‚Äúspace‚Äù and it give me a period. That doesn‚Äôt happen in the app and when you‚Äôre an app all about writing it should feel the same as the rest of my experience on my iPad. 

I think it deserves more that one star but I know that 1 stars are more likely to be seen by the developer and I really want this fixed on a app I‚Äôm paying for.

I updated it a couple days ago and when I opened the app to add another journal, I noticed I had been signed out. I tried logging back in, but the app no longer recognizes my email address. title: Had Potential; Too many requests to go Premium.
review:
I downloaded this as the ad looked interesting. Saw there was a free version and thought why not. 

I set it up and saw which options were available for free and they seemed suitable for what I‚Äôd be using it for. The limit you on your journal entries which was fine with me as I don‚Äôt have the time for that every day. 

Except, you answer the few questions they give you and you are treated with a page telling you all the great feature of Premium... with no way to exit out of it to go back to the home page. I‚Äôve opened the app several times now and have gotten stuck at the ‚ÄúBut wait, there‚Äôs more!‚Äù Ad. 

Had to uninstall. Ultimately, I don‚Äôt think this should be on a monthly subscription, Fairly priced? Yes. I‚Äôd pay about $9.99 for an app like this. Not a monthly subscription however. 

Sorry. Not exactly relaxing when you‚Äôre answering your questions and get stuck on an ad page.

title: Good app but uses Fake quotes
review: ‚ÄúGood things happen to those who hustle‚Äù is not an Ana√Øs Nin quote! The word hustle wasn‚Äôt even in her vocabulary at the time she was alive. I understand these quotes are just circulated over and over again but we need to be more responsible because it just isn‚Äôt right to put words in the mouths of the dead that they never said. It distorts their legacy and who they were. This quote is actually the opposite of everything Ana√Øs Nin wrote about. She wrote about sensuality, enjoying life‚Äôs pleasures, and going deep. She was a bohemian and ‚Äúhustling‚Äù was not what they were about.

title: 10/10 great app!

title: Deceptive App
review:
The app promises a lot to the consumer and people who genuinely want help to be able to track their days and mental health. However, nothing is free when it mostly should be. It is absolutely absurd to be using people like this for their money and only allowing two (if you can even call it two) things for non-premium users. 

At one point in time, the app would tell you that after a period of days you could finally see your stats (no mention of premium). Then guess what happened? I unlocked it of course! But then I couldn‚Äôt see it because I didn‚Äôt want to get premium. Absolutely deceptive.

title: Great app to help with emotions
review: No matter what emotions you are going through I suggest write them down. This app is great because you can choose what making you feel this emotion and explain why. It will help you feel better getting all of it out and written down. Maybe in the future you can look back and see how strong you‚Äôve become by going through that part of time in your life.

title: Great app, needs some fixes
review: Overall, I love the format and I even paid for the year long membership. That being said, the app crashes every time I try to write more that 100ish words (which is specifically something the paid membership is supposed to let you do). Definitely get this if you‚Äôre looking for some way to organize your thoughts, BUT skip the paid membership until they have some serious bug fixes... it‚Äôs a waste of $50.

title: Lovely
review:

I also think it‚Äôs beautiful and like the graphics they use as a cover for each day. I‚Äôm considering getting premium for the stats!

As for suggestions:
‚Ä¢change the ‚Äúpretty bad‚Äù expression. It looks moreso surprised than sad

also, it would be nice if there was a ‚Äúsearch‚Äù feature so that you could use keywords to look at your past entries

this app is nice and streamlined for entering your thoughts , but if you want to go back and read them, it‚Äôs harder to find a specific day

update: 2 months in and this app is still OK. i do get a little frustrated sometimes because i will type up a lot about my day,and then the app won‚Äôt save it and i‚Äôll have lost everything i wrote for that entry (it‚Äôs very frustrating)

title: Poor Solution to Help Those Who Hurt
review: Anxiety and depression can be a hard enough struggle to live with and for some people that defines their daily life. No one wants to feel these feelings and getting a release is hard to find at times. Considering that the app company says it‚Äôs relatively easy to set up and keep track of your mood, it forgets to leave out one detail. Payed subscription... I understand that nothing is free and there must be profit from services, but setting such high prices and expecting desperate, hurting people to pay those prices to meet their needs is just vile. This app proves that in the world capitalist values trump human decency in modern society.

title: Very good

title: i want my money back

title: A great app!

title: The old format worked better
review:
For me I love this app! I love it so much I paid for it.. and the reason for that is that it had a pretty good format... you can edit it the way you want. 
Unfortunately, the new format low key changes that..

Sometimes I look in my old journal (a real journal) and go to the app and jot it down because I loved that I can add cute or funny pictures to express myself... but now it‚Äôs in the moment .. so I can‚Äôt edit the date.. and i would sometimes write the next day or 12:00 am so it‚Äôll say it is the next day when it‚Äôs actually yesterday.. 

And not to be like that I know it‚Äôs y‚Äôall app but it‚Äôs no where close to better... the last format is what made your app your app.. I use to recommend all my friends to this app because they would be like oooh what‚Äôs that? And now it‚Äôs sad I‚Äôm sorry... 

And now it takes longer to find old stories because of how it is..

Even tho it‚Äôs still your app but I‚Äôm not getting what I paid for and it‚Äôs very upsetting

title: Great!!

I used to keep a journal but it‚Äôs a hassle to write in there, but you use your phone everyday, it‚Äôs natural to use this app as a mini journal. It‚Äôs only been a few days but I already love it.

title: Disappointed
review: From what I saw on advertisements seemed like it offered a lot, instead it seemed so basic for going with premium. Also didn‚Äôt have an option for trial period and it said before I purchased that if unsatisfied could get refund as long as within 14 days, which was a lie. If you are so sure of your app you should provide a trial period to try it out. If not you clearly know your app isn‚Äôt worth the cost and just want to get the money from customers. There are plenty of other apps that give trial periods and end up being definitely worth the cost, not this one if your looking for journaling and self reflection and such.

title: Good idea

title: Paid?

This is not what I imagined somewhere that I kept all my daily activities to end up like. If I have to pay just to write 2 sentences about my day I‚Äôm not doing it. I will now be downloading another app. I really wish this app could just go back to how it used to be. CHANGE IT BACK TO HOW IT WAS AT THE END OF 2019!!!

title: Don‚Äôt like new update

On the other hand I do like how there is more mood options.

title: Needs Fixing But Still A Great App
review: The only thing that I would change about this app is to stop making people try to pay for almost everything that would help WAYY more. Don‚Äôt get me wrong thought I do like this app because I can still put on my mood and make themes and put notes and I have inspirational notes daily. And tons more. Just stop trying to make me pay for things that would help me way more than what I just have. Thank you!

title: Don‚Äôt like the in-app purchases
review: It‚Äôs a great app, but would be way better without the in-app purchases, or with them being a little less expensive. People download this to get help when they can‚Äôt afford to, and having stuff locked without purchase is just dangling help in front of them, just out of reach. I get that you guys want to make a profit... but mental health is more important than money, and if people can‚Äôt afford the full access version of the app, then they aren‚Äôt getting much help from Reflectly.

title: Helpful.
