review: This app is great. It helps me practice being mindful and being reflective has definitely helped me feel happier in a more regular basis. The only problem is the choices for mood are a little bit limited. There are days where my day is dominated by an emotion that they don‚Äôt offer as an option to choose and then I don‚Äôt know what to put. Maybe add a ‚ÄúCreate your own‚Äù option like they do for the categories of why your day was bad/good.

title: I love this app!
review: I‚Äôm in love with the app. i‚Äôm excited to get on it and log my mood. i enjoy it and the fact that it‚Äôs customizable. i also enjoy the fact that i can write as much as i want. i tried journaling but i couldn‚Äôt really get into it but i like journaling here now. i would definitely recommend because it‚Äôs super fun, easy, and quick. i‚Äôm excited for the next day so i can log in reflecty. love it!

This app is very helpful and is very easy to figure out. It listens, it helps, and it cares. Some may say it‚Äôs just an app and you need to talk to real people to get problems off your chest, but have they ever actually tried? You have no idea how difficult it is to tell people serious problems, but with this app it is so easy and efficient! This app really works and I highly recommend it.

title: Amazing app
review: I have been very sad lately about my grandparents death, so then I Downloaded Refletly and it‚Äôs been helping a lot with my sadness. It has also helped me follow my dreams of building a computer tomorrow, because before I downloaded, I thought the computer would be terrible. But now, after reading through all the motivational speeches, I see that I can do anything. This computer is gonna be amazing!!

title: "Free" app is misleading
review:
I have been using Reflecty for almost a year now. When I started, I had access to prompts and almost all of the now "premium" features. As the app updated over the year, I lost access to all of these features and Reflecty became a glorified notes app for me to journal without prompts. It did motivate me to write an entry every day.

However, the newest update forces me to pay for premium even to write another entry. I do not want to pay for something I have been doing for free for a year. I am very disappointed in Reflecty, and if you are expecting a free app this is not one.

title: I like it better than my therapist:)
review: I like this app so far. I don‚Äôt have the premium version cause I‚Äôd have to ask my parents and they‚Äôd say no to paying for that. But I like this app better than talking to my therapist cause I feel like someone is listening to me and it‚Äôs not as awkward because it‚Äôs not a real person. But I still feel like someone cares when I type on Reflectly.   :)

title: My Rating
review:
I really like this app for multiple reasons... 
-Its easy to use. 
-Its welcoming.
-Theres no ads. 
-Its nice to write stuff down if you 
easily forget stuff. 

But there are also some things about this app that I rather don't like...
-Its one of those apps that you 
need to buy and purchase things to 
get what the app offers. 

I understand that when you buy an app, your going to have to purchase things within the app. I know that. But still, if theres someone out there that just wants somewhere where they can write down their thoughts so they feel like they are being listened to. Or if theres someone who just needs to know what their emotions are but checking this app to tell them, then by all means they should have access to that. We shouldn't have to buy reassurance.

title: Pretty good.

For example, if you want to make an entry where you were sick then you have to choose and emotion, Which most of the time doesn‚Äôt match up. There is a premium feature, but you can still do the app 100% in free version. I‚Äôve gotten premium once and I would say that it‚Äôs mostly worth it.

title: Amaaaaaaaaaazing
review: This app has helped me through so much you have no idea! This probably sounds like a robot writing this but reflectly has changed me and my life for the better! I know how to recognize my emotions and reflect on my day. I‚Äôm only 14 so this is important things to learn during this hard time in life, especially thinking about how my mental health effects my future! Learning now will really help with it.

title: Love it!!üòç
review: Reflectly helps me to reflect and focus on the good parts of my day! It helps to get it all out and not worry about someone finding out my personal thoughts. title: It‚Äôs pretty good
review: Overall it‚Äôs a great app I‚Äôve been doing it for quite awhile now. I‚Äôve been writing everyday and the cute notifications saying good morning or afternoon are lovely. title: Great app!

Solid 5/5! Would recommend!

title: I Love This With a Passion!!!

title: Please don‚Äôt waste your time

title: All I want to do is have a app for mental health that I don‚Äôt pay a monthly fee for.

Pros
- personal
- slightly customizable in terms of general aesthetic and design.
- easy ui nothing over the top
- simple and clean with a splash of color
Cons
- the image integration isn‚Äôt great it‚Äôs a bit lack luster (it‚Äôs nice but not quite there just yet)
- moods and reason behind them are varied but few in comparison 
- no icon search bar for when set a new mood or reason

Verdict 
I love this little Ai journal atm but then again I am still on a couple days deep so I‚Äôll update if anything goes right or wrong in the future

title: Give it time...
review: At first the app felt to simplistic and not interactive enough but over time, as it asks new questions and tracks your moods and stressors, I have found that it really is very helpful for self reflection. I would really like if they had a way to export the writings though so minus one star for that. I also wouldn‚Äôt mind a little more variety with what you can do on the app but it‚Äôs good for what it is and it has a very clean aesthetic look to it that is calming.

title: Hate this new update.
review: Okay so I love this app don‚Äôt get me wrong but I hate this new update. Sometimes at night I forget to type what happened and it is super late so I am like well I will type it tomorrow morning but no now it only lets me type for the day that it is. This made me so mad I almost deleted the app right then and there. I don‚Äôt like this new set up at all I want the old app back where I can have my own cover photos and not this crap that they have now. Please fix this!!!

title: Amazing
review: This app is really amazing. Because of it I‚Äôm paying more attention to how I feel through out the day just so I can say how amazing my day was. title: Amazing tech journal!
review: It was super cool, and it is a love you more way to let my feelings out but still be able to keep it to myself. I loved this app as soon as I saw the add.  I had to try it. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because I had to journal my entire week to unlock my stats, only to figure out that I had to use premium. I hate paying for apps.  I really wish I didn't have to buy it.  Other than that, I really love the app.

title: Great
review: I love how you can edit your story about your day at any time and I love that in the beginning it has you write down what‚Äôs making you emotional and what emotions your having. What I don‚Äôt really like is that it makes you write 6 stories before you can unlock your stats. That‚Äôs the only issue I‚Äôve had so far but another thing i love about this app is that it has a passcode on it.

title: This is the best app I‚Äôve ever seen
review: This is the best app I‚Äôve ever seen because it doesn‚Äôt make you have to pay monthly $50!üòÅ It would remind me if I forgot to get on the app so I would never forget to get on.üòç Thus if anyone had any problems I would be confused on what that would be.üßê If your reading this to see if it‚Äôs a good app I say downloading it will be the best thing you really ever did!ü§© I rate this app a five!ü•≥

title: Since when am I so deep?

I recommend this app for anyone wanting to dive deeper into themself or to practice writing. I can‚Äôt wait to look back on my entries in the future

title: I‚Äôm 100% stress free!

A person like me who likes to go on their phone a lot during the day can find this helpful if your feeling down or in need of motivation. I look forward to write down my day all on my phone rather than to do something else. Super great app.

title: I love this app.

I have had no trouble at all, I am very impressed by this, I mean who knew that just one app could make you feel special. I highly recommend this app if you have a lot of bad days or you just need someone to talk to, maybe your going through a really tough time.

title: I LOVE THIS APP
review: I have only had this app for a week and I LOVE IT. It helps me reflect on my day in a way my journal just didn't! title: Really good! :)
review:
It‚Äôs a really good app for having something/Someone To talk too, When you live alone with no help, It‚Äôs really nice that something cares for you. don‚Äôt get me wrong, I have friends family a cat, But do they ask how my day was or do they go to work and not give a crAp AbOut Me!
Anyways, rate it a 5 star cause this app is caring for people like me, Don‚Äôt know why I did this, I just think this needs some support.

title: Amazing to reflect on how your day went
review: Reflectly is an amazing app to reflect on your day. Whether it was good or bad. You can submit reasons why it was good or bad. Or possibly what caused your day to be that way. You can submit how ever you were feeling throughout the day and you can always go back and edit it if you forgot something. Anyway, that was my review for Reflectly and I would definitely recommend it.

title: add some spice
review: i‚Äôve been using this app for several months now and i love it BUT i wish you guys would add more emotions- it‚Äôs like.. happy, sad, angry, confused.. why not add annoyed, irritated, busy, and so on? that goes for activities as well. and those aren‚Äôt really detailed or anything. perhaps being able to choose, ‚Äúother‚Äù and choosing the desired icon and giving it a personal title. i‚Äôve tried the premium trial and it‚Äôs not really anything special. just a few suggestions, hope you take them into consideration.

title: Awesome App!

title: Amazing!!

title: When all went wrong Reflectly help me through it
review: I was having a rough time with life a couple months ago. Reflectly helped me realize that I should open up more to my mom and to my friends. I‚Äôm glad that I found this app ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

title: Reflectly Is An Awesome App!

title: Not worth a penny yet costs $40
review: It‚Äôs not terrible, but also not worth it for the money. Keeps getting frozen mid entry so I lose everything I‚Äôve written . In order to write an entry,  It forces you to ‚Äúrate your day/ answer how you felt today‚Äù With only 4 ‚Äúmoods‚Äù to choose from. Then asks ‚Äúwhat made your day so (good/ bad)‚Äù and only let‚Äôs you pick one option (work, family, travel...basic vague categories). It asks about how you felt today, even if it‚Äôs 9AM! I don‚Äôt know how my day was today, it just started. Nothing new or unique here. Nothing helpful or ‚Äúinspiring ‚Äú . Lackluster.  Looks better than it is. I regret paying for it.

title: Feel that this app stole my money, Super disappointed in lack of functions
review: I was cornered to sign up for the 7 day trial and then be charged $48 for an annual membership. This app is basically just a journal a day with notifications and limited prompts. I don‚Äôt need it because I already journal and have a therapist asking me those questions. It‚Äôs for someone who hs never self reflected or visited a therapist.  Like maybe it‚Äôs good for a high schooler or lost college student. I‚Äôm disappointed that I got stuck in a year membership when I am so sure as of this moment, 8 days after I used the app once that it isn‚Äôt going to offer me much.

title: I wish we didn‚Äôt have to pay to see our stats
review:
I get that the app needs some kind of revenue but I was salty to see that we had to pay a subscription to get the premium or whatever. I really liked the idea of stats, just to see where my moods went and so. 
But it‚Äôs okay, I‚Äôm still going to use this app to journal my thoughts when I don‚Äôt feel like writing by hand. 
I like the little questions it asks after you do an entry.

title: Great app that keeps me journaling but.....
review:

Love this app guys, keep find what you do! :)

title: Reflectly Review
review: I love this app, it‚Äôs nice being able to reflect on your day. Tracking your moods, getting asked questions. Gives you a sense of comfort. title: 5 Months of Journaling Lost With New Update
review:
If this is user error, I‚Äôll have to accept that. 

But after updating, Reflectly said it didn‚Äôt recognize my email. I went ahead and created a new account to see if I could solve the issue. No where I‚Äôm creating a new account does it prompt you to create an email and password. But once I went on the ‚ÄòAccount‚Äô homepage, that‚Äôs where it shows a button that says ‚ÄúCreate An Account‚Äù, something I don‚Äôt think I did when I downloaded it 5 months ago because I didn‚Äôt realize that was a separate step. 

I‚Äôm devastated to think that 5 months of journaling is gone. Journaling and reflecting that meant so much to me. That I can‚Äôt look back on and see my concrete progress. 

Reflectly should make creating a login and password actually a part of creating an account. Not after the fact to leave it up to users to figure out.

title: Reflectly

title: Amazing

title: Pretty good.

title: Amazing!
review:
Reflectly is an amazing app! I‚Äôve come to enjoy using it to reflect on myself and know what I can do better to live a better life. 
However, there‚Äôs this one pop-up about getting free premium that stops me from doing a lot of things that were unlocked for me before. It‚Äôs become really annoying and it‚Äôs been ruining my ability to use the app. If you could fix that, it would be great!

I just started again because I was in a group call for school, (it‚Äôs an anxiety group) and she said to write down thoughts in my journal üìì. I did not want one because I did not want anyone to see them, but then I remembered this app and I tried it again, (just did try it) and I feel really great

title: Reflectly Rating
review: Overall, I very much like the app so far. It is very calming and I feel like a lot of good is coming out of it. Some things I‚Äôm not the biggest fan of is that the app is constantly asking you to buy the premium version and they notify you at least eight times a day. Other than those two things I really am enjoying the app.

title: Love it!!
review: I got this app back in February when I was having mental health issues, and it really helped. The diary entries give you a chance to look back on how your day went, why it went that way, and what you can do differently. Dealing with emotions is a huge part of relieving stress, and I believe this app helps a lot that.

title: I love this app!!!
review: This is a great app it is great to take all the stress or happiness of the day and easily reflect on it and then you can look back on it later. It is something I look forward to in the morning because I get to see inspiring quotes before I start my day. I would definitely recommend!

title: I like it
review:
I wish there was another option with the check in. In between "completely ok" or "somewhat bad", I wish there was a "somewhat OK".

I feel like I‚Äôm not able to accurately check in because of that. But overall I like it. I like that I‚Äôm thinking about my emotions and taking time to reflect and write, even if it‚Äôs once every other day.

title: Simple But Deep
review: Love the reflection questions (although now they disappeared and I can‚Äôt figure out how to get them back) but there needs to be more moods and reasons. We experience a range of emotions, duh. The tracking is so useful and the motivations are a nice reminder when I‚Äôm feeling down. Entries are simple and can be quick so I use it more often than my normal journal.

title: How I‚Äôve grown
review: I can‚Äôt open up. I didn‚Äôt know how much I can get of my chest in one day. I‚Äôve used it as a diary and my mood has much improved. I‚Äôm 14 and up until last year I hid all my emotions and usually cried myself to sleep. Now I can open up more; this has not only helped me, but trained my to say something.

title: Good app, but...

After the update, I am unsure on how to log back in. As of right now, I‚Äôm about to give up and simply find a different app. Does anyone have any ideas or know how to log in to an already existing account? Thanks much!

title: Bugs
review: I like the app and the idea of it, but it‚Äôs very buggy. The dates on the app doesn‚Äôt match the actual date. For instance May 17, 2020 is a Sunday but on the app for me it shows as Tuesday. When I open the app and make a new entry the texts glitch as well. At times it‚Äôs unable to save my writing for some reason even if my internet is fine. I get so frustrated because I can‚Äôt even copy and paste my writing so I have to rewrite a new entry and pray it‚Äôll save this time or just give up.

The apps great and I‚Äôm sure the team are good people but it‚Äôs a bit of a bummer that all my progress as a person is gone

3/5 because the concept is great but -2 starts for the execution.

title: This honestly is a waste of money
review: All this app does is give you a place to journal. Nothing is customizable. You have like 8 emotions to choose from and 8 categories for them to pertain to. Sanvello, Headspace, and Wysa are all higher quality in their free version than this app. Please learn from my mistake and don‚Äôt waste your money here.

title: READ THIS REVIEW
review:
Hi, this is an important review so please read if you are considering installing this app!!
- -
This is an app that asks you a reflection question every day, and allows you to write down how your day went. It offers inspirational quotes and statistics on how your mood check-ins have gone. I thought this app was going great until I was only able to do TWO moos check-ins, then it said I have to pay. I think that‚Äôs genuinely so dumb, it should give you so much more time. 
- -
The subscription is something like 1.50 a month so it‚Äôs barely anything but I just wanted to let everyone know that you literally will not be able to use this app without paying.
 - -
Have a great day everyone! ‚òÖ

‚Äúbe prepared for stress relief , reducing anxiety & depression in your life. your self-care and mental health should always be a priority.‚Äù 

well that obviously was a lie.

that is only IF you have the money to pay. 

i understand you need money to run the app or whatever , but for a mental health app ?? seriously ?? cmon now.

we want to journal for our health and for our well being , but we obviously can‚Äôt do that with you constantly asking if we want premium.

no i don‚Äôt want premium! i want an app where i can just write and not worry about paying for stuff.

this app had potential , a lot of potential actually. but still terribly failed.

title: I‚Äôm kinda unhappy now.
review: This app used to be really great! But now you have to pay for everything. I understand needing money to be able keep the app up, but I can‚Äôt do daily check-ins anymore because I need to upgrade my thing, however that requires paying money. This is a personal Journal to record stuff. I used this as a coping mechanism back when I first started using it. I‚Äôm not going to spend money on a virtual Journal.

I love the way the app works. You can write as little or as many things in your entry as you want.

I do think their should be a few more options for the mood check/ins. The moods should have two more Ex: meh, and kinda good. And the reasons page should have a few more options, including ‚Äúother‚Äù.

I would also recommend adding at least one more specification, or give the option to.

That‚Äôs all I‚Äôve got to say. I love the app, and I‚Äôm interested to see features that may be added in the future!

title: disappointed in premium feature block
review: i downloaded this app almost a year ago and enjoyed it at first, but recently all functionality is locked for basic users. it‚Äôs no longer a freemium app, but purely a paid subscription. for an app with a focus on mental health that‚Äôs marketed towards teens & young adults, locking existing users out of their content is shameful. many of the people you market to cannot afford $60/year for a premium membership & taking away a helpful tool from someone struggling with mental health is a sure fire way to worsen the state of their mental health. this cash grab shows that this app doesn‚Äôt truly care about mental health, but rather profiting off struggling people during a time of hardship across the world.

title: THIS APP TOOK MY MONEY AND I WANT A REFUND
review:
First of when I downloaded this app I had no idea that was based of a free temporary subscription, so I probably had the app for 3 days, and that was around last month..
I received a notification that 50 dollars was withdrawn from my account at this time I was subscribed to another app.. so I just assumed it was the app.
Until 2 days ago this app withdrew my money and I was able to trace where it was from
I want my money back.
